data.Sentence_cn: 课文33  教育
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 33 Education

data.Sentence_cn: 为什么教育在没有书籍的部落社会是民主的?
data.Sentence: Why is education democratic in bookless tribal societies?

data.Sentence_cn: 教育是我们这个时代的关键词之一。
data.Sentence: Education is one of the key words of our time.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们许多人都相信，一个没有受过教育的人，
data.Sentence: A man without an education, many of us believe,

data.Sentence_cn: 是逆境的牺牲品，被剥夺了20世纪的最优越的机会之一。
data.Sentence: is an unfortunate victim of adverse circumstances, deprived of one of the greatest twentieth-century opportunities.

data.Sentence_cn: 现代国家深深懂得教育的重要性，对教育机构投资，收回的‘利息’
data.Sentence: Convinced of the importance of education, modern states 'invest' in institutions of learning to get back 'interest'

data.Sentence_cn: 便是培养出大批有知识的男女青年，这些人可能成为未来的栋梁。
data.Sentence: in the form of a large group of enlightened young men and women who are potential leaders.

data.Sentence_cn: 教育，以其教学周期如此精心地安排，
data.Sentence: Education, with its cycles of instruction so carefully worked out,

data.Sentence_cn: 并以教科书 -- 那些可以买到的智慧源泉 -- 予以强化，如果不受其惠，文明将会是个什么样子呢？
data.Sentence: punctuated by textbooks -- those purchasable wells of wisdom -- what would civilization be like without its benefits?

data.Sentence_cn: 至少，这些是可以肯定的：虽然我们还会有医生和牧师、
data.Sentence: So much is certain: that we would have doctors and preachers,

data.Sentence_cn: 律师和被告、婚姻和生育，但人们的精神面貌将是另一个样子。
data.Sentence: lawyers and defendants marriages and births -- but our spiritual outlook would be different.

data.Sentence_cn: 人们不会重视‘资料和数据’，而靠好记性、
data.Sentence: We would lay less stress on 'facts and figures' and more on a good memory,

data.Sentence_cn: 实用心理学与同伴相处的能力。
data.Sentence: on applied psychology, and on the capacity of a man to get along with his fellow-citizens.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果我们的教育制度仿效没有书籍的古代教育，我们的学院将具有可以想象得出的最民主的形式了。
data.Sentence: If our educational system were fashioned after its bookless past we would have the most democratic form of 'college' imaginable.

data.Sentence_cn: 在部落中，通过传统继承的知识为所有人共享，并传授给部落中的每一个成员。
data.Sentence: Among tribal people all knowledge inherited by tradition is shared by all;

data.Sentence_cn: 从这个意义上讲，人人受到的有关生活本领的教育是相等的。
data.Sentence: it is taught to every member of the tribe so that in this respect everybody is equally equipped for life.

data.Sentence_cn: 这就是我们最进步的现代教育试图恢复的“平等起步”的理想状况。
data.Sentence: It is the ideal condition of the 'equal start' which only our most progressive forms of modern education try to regain.

data.Sentence_cn: 在原始文化中，寻求和接受传统教育的义务对全民都有约束力。
data.Sentence: In primitive cultures the obligation to seek and to receive the traditional instruction is binding to all.

data.Sentence_cn: 因而没有“文盲”（如果这个字眼儿可以用于没有文字的民族的话）。而我们的义务教育成为法律在德国是在1642年，
data.Sentence: There are no'illiterates' -- if the term can be applied to peoples without a script -- while our own compulsory school attendance became law in Germany in 1642,

data.Sentence_cn: 在法国是在1806年，在英国是在1876年。
data.Sentence: in France in 1806, and in England in 1876 and is still nonexistent in a number of 'civilized' nations.

data.Sentence_cn: 这说明，经过了多么漫长的时间之后，我们才认识到，有必要确保
data.Sentence: This shows how long it was before we deemed it necessary to make sure

data.Sentence_cn: 我们的孩子享有多少个世纪以来由‘少数幸运者’所积累起来的知识。
data.Sentence: that all our children could share in the knowledge accumulated by the 'happy few' during the past centuries.

data.Sentence_cn: 荒凉地区的教育不是钱的问题，
data.Sentence: Education in the wilderness is not a matter of monetary means.

data.Sentence_cn: 所有的人都享有平等起步的权利。
data.Sentence: All are entitled to an equal start.

data.Sentence_cn: 那里没有我们今天社会中的匆忙生活，而匆忙的生活常常妨碍个性的全面发展。
data.Sentence: There is none of the hurry which, in our society, often hampers the full development of a growing personality.

data.Sentence_cn: 荒凉地区的孩子无时无刻不在父母关怀下成长。
data.Sentence: There, a child grows up under the everpresent attention of his parents;

data.Sentence_cn: 因此，丛林和荒凉地区不知道什么叫“青少年犯罪”。
data.Sentence: therefore the jungles and the savannahs know of no 'juvenile delinquency'.

data.Sentence_cn: 人们没有必要离家谋生，所以不会产生孩子无人管的问题，也不存在父亲无力为孩子支付教育费用而犯难的问题。
data.Sentence: No necessity of making a living away from home results in neglect of children, and no father is confronted with his inability to 'buy' an education for his child.
